flawed_nl_solution:
The first night he read 20% of his 500-page book so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is 500 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 500-100 = <<500-100=400>>400 pages
The second night he reads 20% of the 500 pages so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is now 400 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 400-100 = <<400-100=300>>300 pages
The third night he read 30% of the book so he read 0.3*500 = <<30*0.01*500=105>>105 pages
The book is now 300 pages and he read 105 pages so he has 300-105 =<<300-105=195>>195 pages left to read
#### 195

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 150, not 105. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
